reviews.text: We are adult mom and daughter. Stayed here only one night on way to Italy. But it was awesome. When we go back to Paris, we will definitely try to book here. You cannot beat price (110E) or location (Ile de la Cite), across from Notre Dame.
reviews.title: Excellent location, big bath for Europe!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Room #7. Room is small, but clean. Bathroom is very large
reviews.title: Great value & location in Paris
A Wonderful Stay!
reviews.text: by European standards and had a full bath along with removeable hand-held shower head. Nothing fancy, but the staff were very friendly and

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: spoke English very well.
reviews.title: Absolutely Great Budget Hotel

reviews.text: If seeing doctors and patients (and really, quite infrequently) would unnerve you, then you might look elsewhere. (My mom was nurse and sister is nurse and two brothers-in-law are doctors. So we had no issue with it.)
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location
Great location - dickey lift.
reviews.text: Many thanks to this forum for tips on this well situated hostel and particularly to the person who gave such good directions on access as we arrived at night with heavy luggage.

Attic type room small but clean. Did not need to use the aircon. Window positioned on roof line and we left it partially open all the time. Was a luxury to have a bath every day after sightseeing. Safe in the room but no fridge. No English TV channel did not bother us but insufficient light for reading was a nark. We needed to use torches to read.
reviews.title: Perfect Paris Location

likes.liked: — the price, the location, and hearing the bells of the Notre Dame each day
likes.disliked: — no shower curtain, so had to take a bath each morning. oh well.

reviews.text: Staff helpful and supplied hot water free for my tea bags. I had my own sugar and bought little milk containers from a store. H'ever you could purchase cups of tea/coffee from the office. There is also a small staff cafe downstairs where I had 'cup of soup'; hubby had sandwich. I don't care for continental type breakfasts so gave that a miss.
reviews.title: Unique and outstanding family experience!

likes.liked: — the fact that it was in an old hospital
likes.disliked: — rooms were a little small but adequate

reviews.text: I took the lift to 4th or ground floor to have a smoke.
reviews.title: Hotel Dieu Redeemed themselves

reviews.text: Office closes at 10pm but you have a keycard for entry. Lift packed it in on last day so we used another one to the 4th floor and then used the stairs. Bit awkward lugging our heavy cases down two floors then a walk to the other lift then more stairs to exit. But Paris was only part of our trip so we had clothes for cold and warm weather packed.
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay

likes.disliked: — Nothing - it was a perfect hotel for the price

reviews.text: This was a girlfriend getaway, it was the most awesome trip I have ever taken. I love Paris and can't wait to return. I will definitely stay at the Hotel Dieu. It was an awesome place to stay, everyone was very friendly and helpful. 2 of the girls in our group are nurses and one is a pharmacy tech. They loved seeing the hospital. Walking out of the hotel on the first morning and seeing the Notre Dame cathedral was amazing. We used the subway and bus systems to get everywhere. The transportation system around Paris is so easy to use. There are a lot of restaurtants within walking distance. We tried several while we were there and everyone of them was excellent. We stayed in the Hotel Dieu for 7 nights and really enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Just loved Paris!

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and found this hotel to be ideal for us as first time visitors to Paris. Good rates,110 euro per night for a double room (breakfast is extra and delivered to your room), great location being right on the Parvis du Notre Dame and just over the bridge from the Latin quarter with it's vibrant nightlife. Hotel is only yards away from the Metro and RER making it easy to visit all the main attractions. Rooms basic but clean and comfortable, and staff were very helpful and friendly. A bit weird staying in a working hospital but the building and grounds were lovely.
reviews.title: top location

likes.disliked: — no lounge in hotel or tea/coffee facilities in room.

reviews.text: If you want all mod cons then this is not the hotel for you, but if you want a good budget hotel in an excellent location to explore the city then I would definitely recommend this.
reviews.title: Short on cash but want a great location? Look No Further!
Unbeatable location
reviews.text: What a great idea for a hotel; on top of a hospital! Initially, it was a bit odd to have folks wheeled by on gurnies and to see others outside smoking with their IV bag, but, it was easy enough to get used to. Thanks to the other reviewers who left directions into the hotel, or, it might have been difficult to find the entrance.

First, the location cannot be beat. Right on Notre Dame square, you have access to metro stations and are right by the Latin Quarter. There were so many restaurants in the area that we never went hungry (including Nos Ancetres Les Gaulois).
reviews.title: Loved Hotel-Hospitel!
The Center of Paris
reviews.text: We entered the hospital and soon walked out an exit on the right, to behold a beautiful gothic courtyard that you would expect to see on an estate. We climbed one flight of stairs which lead us into another section of the hospital and after 20 steps we found a room with a very large elevator, almost as large as our room!

We arrived on the 6th floor and the elevator opened up right in front of our hotel “ward”. . The reception area was very tiny and upon entering our room, I felt that was tiny, as well. The only window was a sky light so the view consisted of clouds, blue sky, and a few birds, here and there. The tiny closet barely had room for clothes and there was absolutely no furniture for clothes storage. Okay, I can live with this for 8 days. Then, my worst nightmare, a bathtub without a shower curtain. Why can’t a room with a flat screen TV have a bathtub shower curtain? Mind you, this modern TV had only 4 stations and they were all French-speaking.
reviews.title: Quirky - but perfect for us

likes.liked: — Location, near to RER/Metro, Value for £

reviews.title: Location, location, location
reviews.text: As time progressed, what seemed like a room void of most traveler “necessities” transformed into a quaint, enchanted domain. Upon further encounter of the close kind, I realized that this entire room, reception, and hallway were immaculately clean . I mastered the tub situation . Reclining on the bed, one could look out the window & watched the clouds, swallows, rain, snow flakes, and jet paths. It was a pleasure to open and close the sky light window with the push of a button. Rather than a city view, “the sky was the limit!”

likes.disliked: — Long walk though deserted hospital grounds to room at night

reviews.text: If we were hungry or thirsty, we could step outside the room make a right turn, take 12 steps and there were a choice of beverages including water, soda, beer, wine, various teas & coffee. Moreover, snacks were available. If you were real hungry and you did not want to go out, you took the elevator to the 1st floor, descended a flight of steps and a hospital cafeteria served warm food.
reviews.title: Nearly Great, but not quite.

reviews.text: The TV that featured 4 French channels served as my instructor parce que je peut ecouter en francais et my French improved. The hotel staff were charming and ready to help in any way possible.
reviews.title: Excellent, Convenient, Good Price

reviews.text: The hospital grounds are lovely by day, although a little creepy by night, however it is wonderful to sit outside Notre Dame on a warm Summer evening listening to people sing or play guitars and then be able to pop into your room within a minute.
reviews.title: Great visit to Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A few minor issues prevented our stay from being as pleasant as it could have been. Firstly the bath plug didn't fit properly and there was no shower curtain, which ends up annoying you after a few days. The weather was very hot and the air con had an annoying drip when in use - with the noise of people outside if the window was open, and the drip drip if it was shut, I couldn't sleep without ear plugs. The drips only *just* missed the TV too. Staff were told of this but weren't really able to help other than give extra towels to mop up the puddle that formed under the air con.
reviews.title: Why would ANYONE stay ANYPLACE else????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the _only_ hotel in Paris so far where the staff have been patient, very friendly and we actually thought they were nice people. To put it in perspective, we've been to Paris before a quite few times. Hotels and rooms are usually small, substandard, and the staff quirky (Think Fawlty Towers). Even if you spend top dollar, you'll almost always be disappointed.
reviews.title: These guys don't need a review

reviews.text: I agree with the comment about it being like staying with friends. The other reviews adequately describe the centrality and the cleanliness. At last! - a reasonably priced hotel in Paris that I would go back to. There are issues with access, but we quickly forgot about that. Don't go up the stairs when you come in - go down the small set of stairs instead to the lift in the basement (SS), if you have a lot of bags. We're definitely going back in a couple of years, and will be booking well ahead to get a room at the HHD.
reviews.title: Smells of death...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I visited this with a view to taking my mum who is 75 years old and confined to a wheelchair; it was recommended in a disability brochure. Location is all, if you've been to Paris you'd have walked past it without noticing; as you face Notre Dame it is directly to your left behind a taxi rank and row of trees. Certainly I'd be able to get my mum out in front of Notre Dame before the swarms of tourists descend at 9am ish.
reviews.title: Good value (for Paris) hotel in a fantastic location

reviews.text: You don't walk in to the hotel reception but the Hopital reception which feels like a dark dank corridor of an English state school, the kind with notice boards and a red fire hose in the corner. Then you turn right and left, across the courtyard and up big stone steps to the lift, which takes you to the sixth floor. You can't get a wheelchair up there, you have to descend five stone steps to access the lift from the basement, where you are in the grim antiseptic bowels of the hospital. On the other side of the courtyard was a lift that could take you down to the basement but it was broken when I went. No real explicit directions to the hotel, care workers look at you with suspicion like you might be there to steal a corpse, one American visitor laughed in my face when I asked where the hotel was, like I must be some idiot. It's that kind of atmosphere.
reviews.title: This was fun

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reception, when you get there, feels like that of a private hospital; orange decor with a bookcase for browsing. You half expect there to be a table with women's magazines and a big box of plastic toys to keep kids occupied. The guy on reception seemed to tell me and my sister that only four rooms were ever available, surely not the case. The rooms were small and not too nice, the skylight is just daft; who wants to wake up when the sun comes up?
reviews.title: Just terrific!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a wonderful stay in this quirky hotel. the location of the hotel makes it the perfect place to walk to virtually all sights in paris. it is in the center of the city and whatever directions you walk in there are sights and sounds to enjoy. it is a little strange to be staying in a hospital, but after walking in the entrance (go towards notre dame, to the left outside the metro stop) you walk past a lovely courtyard, up a flight of stairs to an elevator that takes you to the hotel. it is small, clean and no frills. the room is a comfortable size and the bathroom does not have a shower curtain or pole for you to put up your own. the staff was nice. if this is all you need then this hotel is a wow for the location and convenience.
reviews.title: location makes this hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Dieu over the Easter holidays during a solo trip to Paris (5 nights, single cost 115 Euro/night). I was in Room 14, the single at the end of the hall on the Notre Dame side, and had a lovely view of the left tower lit up at night through the skylight. The room was quite good sized, particularly for a single in Paris, with a comfortable twin bed, 2 chairs, desk and a pull down desk (sorry no pics, the camera broke). As mentioned in previous reviews, no shower curtain, but that was easy to work around as the shower head was a wand and with some careful aim, you could avoid soaking the bathroom! I did not take any breakfasts (the Left Bank with its patisseries and boulangeries is a 5 minute walk away). I found the hotel itself to be very quiet (and I'm a very light sleeper). I would recommend a sleep mask as there are no coverings for the skylights, particularly with longer days in the summer, and while it's not intrusive, I expect the crowds and buskers on the Place du Parvis will stay out later with the warmer weather, so earplugs too if you're sensitive to noise. The grounds are great! Yes, they' re kind of creepy at night, but not in an "about to be attacked" way, more a "what's Dr. Frankenstein cooking up in the lab tonight" way. And the freaky Smurf-with-a-glandular-problem statue in the gardens? A lovely older gentleman and his wife explained that it is a tradition for some hospital patients to add artwork if they had a longer stay, and this particular piece was originally an aristocrat who got a red-white-and-blue paint job, a plaster mask, and a nice Revolutionary red toque! I saw very few patients, and the ones you see might have an IV or an eye patch, nothing dramatic or bloody, so I would not avoid this hotel on that account.
reviews.title: clean, quiet, central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A good value, kind staff, and central. It does lack charm but makes up for that with convenience and quiet. A very good idea, especially if you're traveling solo.
reviews.title: This is where you should stay

reviews.text: We found this interesting, cheap, no frills hotel to be a very good fit for a week of enjoying the core of old Paris. It is indeed across the street from Notre Dame, in the surgical wing (top floor) of Paris' oldest hospital, Hotel Dieu. You will find very minimal amenities, but a gracious and helpful staff. We were provided with a hair dryer upon request and they replaced the spa-toiletries daily. Most of the week we partook in the optional room-service breakfast.The receptionist even booked a restaurant for us despite our embarrassing English language barrier. If you want you can do like us and stand on your bed and peek out the skylight-rooftop windows to grab a view of Paris from your room. Be aware that these skylight windows are the only windows provided. The best part of this place was the location and price. The worst aspect would be that it's in a working hospital - but that really isn't a deterrent for most thrifty travelers and we got over the creepiness of walking past patients and eye surgeons. Actually, the hospital is quite a neat and original medieval complex. A heavy curious feeling came over us while walking the halls at night with the ancient ambiance of the place; it carries such a dramatic history! Don't miss the Heath Ledger 'Joker' statue near the back of the hospital courtyard!
reviews.title: Great location for a hotel in a hospital:):):)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for two nights in this hotel and would very happily stay here again. Our room was a decent size (by European standards), pleasant, exceptionally comfortable. Walls a little thin, but we didn't spend much time in the room. It is a fantastic location and great price.
reviews.title: Unique experience; well worth it
